intro: Solenogyne gunnii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its sword-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant is known for its fibrous bark, which has been historically used by Māori for weaving and crafting. Solenogyne gunnii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and forested areas. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various insect and bird species.
